com.sebastiandine.cardcollectionmanager.ui.dialogs.card

Class DialogMaintainCardObservable

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.sebastiandine.cardcollectionmanager.ui.dialogs.card.DialogMaintainCardObservable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.util.EventListener, java.util.Observer, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener

    public class DialogMaintainCardObservable
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, java.util.Observer, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    This class provides the functionality to add or edit CardBean objects, by managing an internal JDialog object which provides the corresponding UI. It also extends Observable to provide observers the possibility to react on the creation of new CardBean objects resp. editing of existing CardBean objects. This class implements the Singleton pattern, therefore there can only be one card maintenance dialog at a time:
    • Use constructor getInstance() in order to create a new card.
    • Use constructor getInstance(CardBean) in order to edit an existing card.
    Author:
    Sebastian Dine

      • getInstance

        Parameters:
        cardBean - CardBean object, which should be edited.
        Returns:
        Singleton instance in 'edit' mode.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This method coordinates action events, to which this class listens to.
        • If the source of the action event is button 'Save', the internal CardBean object will be stored to container CardBeanContainer.
          • If an existing CardBean object has been edited, the container CardBeanContainer will be updated with the edited CardBean object. observers will be notified together with notification object String 'card_edited'.
          • If a new CardBean object has been created, this object will be added to container CardBeanContainer. observers will be notified together with notification object CardBean, which is the newly created CardBean object.
        • if the source of the action event is button '...', related to the front image, a ImageFileChooserObservable will be generated in order to maintain the front image of the internal CardBean object.
        • if the source of the action event is button '...' related to the back image, a ImageFileChooserObservable will be generated in order to maintain the back image of the internal CardBean object.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method coordinates mouse click events, to which this class listens to. - If the source of the mouse click event is a click in the textfield, related to the front image and if the front image of the internal CardBean object is maintained, this image will be displayed in a new dialog frame (DialogShowCardImage). - If the source of the mouse click event is a click in the textfield, related to the back image and if the back image of the internal CardBean object is maintained, this image will be displayed in a new dialog frame (DialogShowCardImage).
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseEntered

        public void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method changes the background color of the textfields, related to the front and back images, when the mouse hovers over them. The color will only be changed, if the corresponding image is maintained within the internal CardBean object.
        Specified by:
        mouseEntered in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseExited

        public void mouseExited(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method changes the background color of the textfields, related to the front and back images, back to their inital color, when they were changed by method mouseEntered(MouseEvent).
        Specified by:
        mouseExited in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • insertUpdate

        public void insertUpdate(javax.swing.event.DocumentEvent e)
        This method checks, if the user inserts something into the textfield corresponding to the name of the card. If the textfield is not empty, the save button as well as both image upload buttons will be enabled.
        Specified by:
        insertUpdate in interface javax.swing.event.DocumentListener

      • removeUpdate

        public void removeUpdate(javax.swing.event.DocumentEvent e)
        This method checks, if the user removes something from tge textfield corresponding to the name of the card. If the textfield is empty, the save button as well as both image upload buttons will be disabled.
        Specified by:
        removeUpdate in interface javax.swing.event.DocumentListener

      • changedUpdate

        Specified by:

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        This method coordinates updates, once an observed object notifies a change.
        • When the Observable object is an object of class ImageFileChooserObservable, the corresponding image textfield will be updated.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • windowClosing

        public void windowClosing(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
        This method triggers, if the internal JDialog gets closed. If the internal CardBean object has not been saved to the CardBeanContainer, it assumes, that the user hit the 'abort' button on the upper corner (the 'X' button) in order to abort the creation of a new CardBean object. In this case, uploaded image files should be deleted from the disk. Therefore this method calls CardBeanImageServices.deleteImageFiles(CardBean), in this special case.
        Specified by:
        windowClosing in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
